title: Epinephrine (medication)
summary: Epinephrine, also known as adrenaline, is a medication and hormone.[7][8] As a medication, it is used to treat a number of conditions, including anaphylaxis, cardiac arrest, asthma, and superficial bleeding.[5] Inhaled epinephrine may be used to improve the symptoms of croup.[9] It may also be used for asthma when other treatments are not effective.[5] It is given intravenously, by injection into a muscle, by inhalation, or by injection just under the skin.[5]
